metadata.title: Disable SSH Support for User Known Hosts
metadata.description: SSH can allow system users host-based authentication to connect to systems if a cache of the remote systems public keys are available. This should be disabled.

criteria.comment: SSH is not installed or conditions are met

extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required and not installed, or requirement is unset
sshd is required and installed, or requirement is unset

ind:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Tests the value of the IgnoreUserKnownHosts[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
